models.Name: EnergyBudget

Definition.readme:
This model provides visualizations around energy savings.

You can set monthly budgets for energy consumption  and then post regular energy consumption data and get analytics about your usage.

Energy consumption will be classified by their 'energy type'.

An example would be: 'Cooling' or 'Mechanical' or 'Electrical'. These define different kinds of energy consumption.

You can define budgets for different energy types.

## Energy Types

Energy consumption is recorded against an energy type. This can be any label or text - but its recommended you use a simple lower case word. Examples:

* electrical
* mechanical
* cooling

You do not need to predefine your energy types. When you record values for a given energy type, it will automatically get registered as a new type.


### Calculated Energy Types

Sometimes it's useful to see consumption and budget for multiple energy types together.
For example, you can have 'Essential' as one energy type which comprises 'Mechanical' and 'Electrical' and 'Non-Essential' which comprises only 'Cooling'.

You can define new energy types as calculated energy types which have one or more sub-energy types.

You do not directly record energy consumption against these calculated energy types. The consumption will instead be calculated as the sum of all the energy from its sub energy types.

You can add/remove calculated energy types at any time independent of the energy consumption data already being recorded.

## Widgets

### Location Configuration
For locations to appear in the widget list, you need to setup budgets for a location.

### Category Configuratino
For categories to show up in the widget category lists you need to configure category master data and specify an id and label for a category.

Action

outputValues.label: year
outputValues.documentation: The year to delete data for

outputValues.label: location
outputValues.documentation: The location for which data is to be deleted

blocks.docs:
Delete data for a given location and year.
All data for this time period will be deleted.

# Output

```
{"status":"deleted"}
```

blocks.title: Action
blocks.docs:
Delete an energy type as well as all budgets defined for it.

# Output

```
{"status":"deleted"}
```

blocks.title: Action

outputValues.label: year
outputValues.documentation: The year that the data point is added for

outputValues.label: month
outputValues.documentation: The month that the data point is added for. Months go from 1 to 12.

outputValues.label: location
outputValues.documentation: Location to add energy consumption information for

outputValues.label: category
outputValues.documentation: The energy type that this energy is being recorded under

blocks.docs: Update the consumption information for a location and energy type for a given month and year.

blocks.title: ES6Javascript
Action
blocks.docs: Get consumption information for a given energy type, year, month and location

blocks.title: ES6Javascript
Action
blocks.docs:
For a given location, energy type and year, return the monthly consumptions that have been recorded.

If the energy type is a calculated type, the energy consumption data will be the sum of all sub energy types.

# Output

The output consists of an array of location/month/year/value items.

```
[
  {"year":"2020","month":"1","value":"198"},
  {"year":"2020","month":"2","value":"200"},
  {"year":"2020","month":"3","value":"192"}
]
```

blocks.title: ES6Javascript
Action

outputValues.label: location
outputValues.documentation: The location for which budget information has to be retrieved

outputValues.label: category
outputValues.documentation: The energy type for which budget information is to be retrieved. This can be a calculated energy type that has sub-energy types defined for it.

blocks.docs:
Retrieve the monthly energy budgets set for a given location and energy type.

If the energy type has sub energy types defined, the monthly budget values will be the accumulated total of all the sub energy types.

# Output

The response contains an array of budgets for each month. There are 12 items in the array - each item representing a month.

```
{
   "location":"building1",
   "values":[50,23,45,44,52,20,20,30,45,10,20,15]
}
```

blocks.title: Action

outputValues.label: location
outputValues.documentation: The location for which emission data is being configured

outputValues.label: co2
outputValues.documentation: Grams of Co2 emmitted per kWH of power generated

blocks.docs:
Setup carbon dioxide conversion rates for a given location.

The value you provide is the amount of CO2 emission in grams per kWh of power generated.

blocks.title: Action
blocks.docs:
For a given location, energy type and year, return the monthly consumptions that have been recorded.

If the energy type is a calculated type, the energy consumption data will be the sum of all sub energy types.

# Output

The output consists of an array of location/month/year/value items.

```
[
  {"year":"2020","month":"1","value":"198"},
  {"year":"2020","month":"2","value":"200"},
  {"year":"2020","month":"3","value":"192"}
]
```

blocks.title: Action
blocks.docs:
Get all emission configuration information from all locations.
This will return a list of locations and the corresponding rating of grams of CO2 per kWH of power.

This is a measure of how much green-house gases are emitted during power generation.

# Output

```
[
  {"location":"building1","co2":0.208},
  {"location":"building2","co2":0.198}
]
```

blocks.title: ES6Javascript
Action
blocks.docs: Retrieve a list of all defined locations and their energy budgets.

outputValues.documentation: The payload is a JSON structure containing the following: The energy budget for each month in an array.  So  there will be 12 items in the array.

outputValues.documentation: The energy type for which this budget is set

blocks.title: Action
blocks.docs:
Renames a location. This will affect all existing data as well as budgets. You cannot rename a location to one that is already defined.

# Output

```
{"status":"ok"}
```

sources.name: GetBudget
sources.docs:
Retrieve the monthly energy budgets set for a given location and energy type.

If the energy type has sub energy types defined, the monthly budget values will be the accumulated total of all the sub energy types.

# Output

The response contains an array of budgets for each month. There are 12 items in the array - each item representing a month.

```
{
   "location":"building1",
   "values":[50,23,45,44,52,20,20,30,45,10,20,15]
}
```

parametersExtended.docs: The location for which budget information has to be retrieved
The energy type for which budget information is to be retrieved. This can be a calculated energy type that has sub-energy types defined for it.
